result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Riggio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony J. Riggio is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony J. Riggio was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Riggio

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: pulled from stack - not yet sent to ONSO _
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

2:54 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Riggio in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. Defendant wishes to accept State's offer. Defendant still wishes to proceed on own - State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement provided to defendant and filed with Court. Schiek/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any treatment deemed appropriate by PO for issues described in criminal complaint. 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:09 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:14 a.m. Defendant Anthony J. Riggio in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that discussions have been held; no formal offer will be made until DA speaks with victim - requests adjournment. Defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver of counsel free and voluntary. Bail continued. Adj. 11:20 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:54 p.m. Court Commissioner John Hogan. Defendant Anthony J. Riggio in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to proceed on own. Bail continued. Adj. 3:56 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 11:15 am.
defendant had posted bond to be released but sig bond done - bond returned to person who posted
No contact with victim MH, except by telephone or electronic means for purposes of issues of minor child ONLY.

1:28 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Riggio in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:30 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
